results.title: The Day of the locust
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Jerome Hellman, Long Road Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A scathing take on 1930s Hollywood motion picture industry, this film was only a moderate success at the time of release, despite garnering two Academy Award nominations. Adapted from Nathanael West’s novel the film principally charts the ambitions of Faye Greener (Karen Black), a talent-less starlet dreaming of fame, well beyond her grasp. In Faye’s orbit are Tod Hackett, a budding production designer and Homer Simpson, a wealthy suitor. Both men are driven mad by Faye’s excessive flirtations, yet stubborn unavailability. The narrative builds to a shocking climax. Music composed and conducted by John Barry.

results.title: The Delinquents (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Mike Wilcox, Alex Cutler, Silver Lining Entertainment, Wilcox and Cutler
results.brief_description: Too young to be together, too in love to be apart, Lola and Brownie’s obsessive passion for each other breaks all the rules laid down by their parents and society. Quickly branded as rebels they are forced to separate but they fight all the odds to be reunited. Stars Kylie Minogue, Charlie Schlatter and Angela Punch-McGregor Based on the novel “The Delinquents” by Criena Rohan.

results.title: Fountain
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Shaun Gladwell
results.brief_description: Featuring renowned breakdancer Morganics pulling his moves in a water fountain, Shaun Gladwell’s street-wise video ‘painting’ plays with performance, gravity and time to unsettle expectations of urban space.

results.title: The Delights of Turkey
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger and Grainger Television Australia
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Greg Grainger journeys for 4,000 km around Western Turkey on a motorcycle. Beginning in Istanbul, home of the more liberal Turkish Muslims, we visit famous tourist venues such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the magnificent Grant Bazaar. Travelling along the coast, we see the increasing numbers of young Australians making their pilgrimage to Gallipoli at Anzac Cove. Remains of Roman civilization and architecture are evident throughout Western Turkey and Greg’s group rides in a hot air balloon over the strange cave houses of Cappadocia. Traditional farming and carpet making in rural areas are shown as happily co-existing with the more modern tourist attractions of restaurants, belly dancing and shopping in the cities.

results.title: FleshPool
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Julie Rrap
results.brief_description: Julie Rrap’s unconventional nude study uses digital imaging to stunning effect, creating a fleshy mutant form as a woman slides into her own reflection.

results.title: The Deer hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Cimino, John Peverell, Michael Deeley, Barry Spikings, EMI/Parlophone and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The Deer hunter is a stunning epic exploration of the physical and psychological effects of the Vietnam War on three young working class men from a Pennsylvania steel town. The film is influenced by the sumptuous cinema of Visconti and Bertolluci, combining social observation with lavish tableaus of everyday life. From the opening wedding sequence to the nightmarish scenes in a prisoner of war camp, “The Deer Hunter” is a consistently astounding film that refuses to situate itself as either pro or anti War. Rather than tackling the specific history of the Vietnam war, it becomes instead a moving allegory on all war and on the destruction, it reaps on the psyches of both the victor and the conquered. “The Deer Hunter” won an Academy Award for Best Film and remains one of the best films ever made about war. With Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, John Savage and Meryl Streep. The astonishing cinematography is by Vilmos Zsigmond.
